Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Antimicrobial Drapes in Primary Knee Arthroplasty

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients over 18 years undergoing primary knee arthroplasty, excluding those with iodine allergy, prior knee surgery, septic arthritis, recent antibiotics, or inability to consent.

Intervention.evidence: allocated to either the intervention (antimicrobial drape) or control group

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of antimicrobial drapes in reducing intraoperative microbial contamination during primary knee arthroplasty.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of contaminated patients, measured intraoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence

Number_Analysed.evidence: 603 in the intervention and 584 in the control group were analysed

Result_Outcome.evidence: Contamination occurred in 10% of the intervention group versus 15% in the control group (odds ratio 0.61 [95% CI 0.43 to 0.87]; p = 0.005).
